entities.name: World War II
entities.description: World War II was a global war that lasted from 1939 to 1945, involving the vast majority of the world"s nations. It was the most widespread and deadliest conflict in history.

entities.description: Blending of indoor living areas with outdoor environments

entities.name: Noble Family
entities.description: A noble family is an aristocratic lineage with significant social, political, and economic influence.

entities.name: environmental impact
entities.description: The environmental impact refers to the effects that human activities have on the environment, including pollution, resource depletion, and climate change.

entities.name: home
entities.description: A dwelling place designed for living.

entities.name: modern amenities
entities.description: Innovative facilities designed to enhance living comfort and convenience.

entities.name: 20th century
entities.description: The 20th century spans from the year 1901 to 2000 and is marked by significant advancements in technology, changes in lifestyle, and transformations in home design and architecture.

entities.name: American Dream
entities.description: The American Dream is the set of ideals (such as equality, democracy, and liberty) that are held by many Americans. It often includes the belief in opportunities for prosperity and success, and an upward social mobility achieved through hard work.

attributes.Achievement Method: Hard Work and Upward Social Mobility

entities.name: Basic Shelter

entities.name: renewable energy sources
entities.description: Renewable energy sources are derived from natural processes that are replenished at a faster rate than they are consumed. They include solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass energy.

entities.name: Middle Ages
entities.description: The Middle Ages, also known as the medieval period, spans roughly from the 5th to the late 15th century. It is characterized by significant social, political, and cultural changes.

attributes.Social Structure: Feudal system with noble families governing their lands

entities.name: interconnected devices
entities.description: Devices connected through a network allowing remote control and monitoring.

entities.name: concrete
entities.description: Concrete is a composite material composed of fine and coarse aggregate bonded together with a fluid cement that hardens over time.

attributes.Composition: Fine and coarse aggregate bonded with cement

entities.name: home design

entities.name: MODERNIST MOVEMENT

entities.name: Cultural Influences
entities.description: Cultural influences are the effects of a particular culture on individuals, groups, and society.

entities.name: functionality
entities.description: Functionality refers to the focus on practicality and utility in design.

entities.name: Estate
entities.description: An estate is a large area of land owned by a noble family or other wealthy individual.

entities.name: Resilience
entities.description: Resilience refers to the ability of a system or community to withstand and recover from adverse events.

entities.name: Middle Class
entities.description: The middle class is a social group that typically has moderate income and education levels.

entities.name: Societal Norms
entities.description: Societal norms are the shared expectations and rules that guide behavior in society.

entities.name: Mass Production
entities.description: Mass production is a method of manufacturing goods in large quantities using standardized processes and assembly lines.

entities.name: central heating
entities.description: Central heating is a system that provides warmth to the whole interior of a building or portion of a building from one point to multiple rooms.

entities.name: affordable housing

entities.name: efficiency
